Ownable: caller is not the owner

deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text: @title Governance relayer contract on L1 that receives messages from the owner (Governor) and sends them to L2.
@title Governance relayer contract on L1 that receives messages from the owner (Governor) and sends them to L2.

params._currentChainId: Chain ID for this network. This is configurable by the deployer, rather than automatically detected via `block.chainid` because the type of `currentChainId` should match any `destinationChainId`'s submitted as input to `relayGovernance()`. `relayGovernance()` calls `Bridge.deposit()` which expects a uint8 chainID passed as the first param, but `block.chainid` returns a uint256 value. Due to the possibility that a uint256 --> uint28 conversion leads to data loss and the complexity of mapping safely from uint256 --> uint8 on-chain, we opt to allow the user to specify a unique uint8 ID for this chain. It follows that the `_currentChainId` may not match with `block.chainid`.
params._finder: Address of Finder that this contract uses to locate Bridge.

getResourceId().details: More details about Resource ID's here: https://chainbridge.chainsafe.io/spec/#resource-id

returns._0: bytes32 Hash containing this stored chain ID.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

relayGovernance(uint8,address,bytes).details: The transaction submitted to `to` on the sidechain with the calldata `data` is assumed to have 0 `value` in order to avoid the added complexity of sending cross-chain transactions with positive value.

params.data: Calldata to include in governance transaction.
params.destinationChainId: Chain ID of SinkGovernor that this governance request should ultimately be sent to.
params.to: Contract on network with chain ID `destinationChainId` to send governance transaction to.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

verifyRequest(address,bytes).details: This method should basically check that the `Bridge.deposit()` was triggered by a valid relay event.

params.data: Calldata to include in governance transaction.
params.to: Contract on network with chain ID `destinationChainId` to send governance transaction to.

devdoc.title: Governance relayer contract on L1 that receives messages from the owner (Governor) and sends them to L2.

getResourceId().notice: Gets the resource id to send to the bridge.

relayGovernance(uint8,address,bytes).notice: This is the first method that should be called in order to relay a governance request to another network marked by `destinationChainId`. Note: this can only be called by the owner (presumably the L1 governor).

verifyRequest(address,bytes).notice: This method will ultimately be called after `relayGovernance` calls `Bridge.deposit()`, which will call `GenericHandler.deposit()` and ultimately this method.
